comments.text:
Ran into this last week but it seemed like an issue caused by add-ons.
Either way, here is a break-down of the problem:

At some point 'collapsed="false"' is being set on "chrome://browser/content/browser.xul#TabsToolbar" and then saved into the localstore.rdf, which causes any new windows to appear in the overflowed tabs state.

Note that if you create enough tabs for the overflow to be hit normally and then close tabs, the window returns to the normal not overflowed state.

I also ran into this issue in Minefield on Linux. This has happened on two

comments.text:
From talking to Gavin on IRC, doesn't seem to be only caused by the 'collapsed="false"' being set. This whole block in the localstore.rdf seems to trigger it though:

<RDF:Description RDF:about="chrome://browser/content/browser.xul#TabsToolbar"
                 currentset="tabbrowser-tabs,new-tab-button,alltabs-button,tabview-button,tabs-closebutton"
                 iconsize="small"
                 collapsed="false" />
